modBayonetDescription: Melee Weapon, deals 4 DC Physical Piercing 1 damage
modMarksmanStockDescription: Gains Two-Handed, loses Inaccurate, gains Precision
modRecoilCompensatingStockDescription: Gains Two-Handed, loses Inaccurate, +1 Fire Rate
modFinnedBarrelDescription: +1 damage DC, increases Range by 1 grade
modPortedBarrelDescription: Increases Range by 1 grade, +1 Fire Rate
modVentedBarrelDescription: Increases Range by 1 grade, +1 Fire Rate, gains Reliable
modAutomaticDescription: -1 damage DC, +2 Fire Rate, gains Burst, gains Inaccurate
modReceiver45Description: Damage becomes 4 DC, +1 Fire Rate, Ammo becomes .45
modReceiver50Description: Damage becomes 8 DC, gains Vicious, Ammo becomes .50
modAutomaticPistonReceiverDescription: +2 Fire Rate, reduces Range by 1 grade
modLongNightVisionScopeDescription: Gains Precision, gains Night Vision, increases Range by 1
modReflexSightDescription: Can reroll the Hit Location die
modBeamSplitterDescription: -1 damage DC, gains Spread, -1 Fire Rate, gains Inaccurate, reduces Range by 1 grade
modFullStockEnergyDescription: Gains Two-Handed, gains Piercing 1, loses Close Quarters
modMarksmanStockEnergyDescription: Gains Two-Handed, loses Inaccurate, gains Precision, loses Close Quarters
modRecoilCompensatingStockEnergyDescript: Gains Two-Handed, loses Inaccurate, +1 Fire Rate, loses Close Quarters
modStandardStockDescription: Gains Two-Handed, loses Inaccurate, loses Close Quarters
modAutomaticBarrelDescription: -1 damage DC, loses Close Quarters, increases Range by 1 grade, +1 Fire Rate
modSniperBarrelDescription: +2 damage DC, loses Close Quarters, increases Range by 1 grade, -1 Fire Rate
modFlamerBarrelDescription: -2 damage DC, +2 Fire Rate, gains Burst, reduces Range by 1 grade, gains Inaccurate
modLongBarrelEnergyDescription: Loses Close Quarters, increases Range by 1 grade
modLongReinforcedBarrelDescription: Loses Close Quarters, increases Range by 1 grade, allows muzzle mod
modSplitterDescription: -1 damage DC, gains Spread, gains Inaccurate
modThreeChargeCapacitorDescription: +1 damage DC, consumes 3 ammo per shot
modFourChargeCapacitorDescription: +2 damage DC, consumes 4 ammo per shot
modFiveChargeCapacitorDescription: +3 damage DC, consumes 5 ammo per shot
modSixChargeCapacitorDescription: +4 damage DC, consumes 6 ammo per shot
modLongScopeEnergyDescription: Gains Precision, increases Range by 1 grade
modLongNightVisionScopeEnergyDescription: Gains Precision, gains Night Vision, increases Range by 1 grade
modReflexSightEnergyDescription: Can reroll the Hit Location die
modElectricSignalAntennaDescription: Damage becomes 7 DC Energy, gains Radioactive
modAutomaticSignalRepeaterDescription: +2 Fire Rate, gains Burst, loses Blast
modDeepDishDescription: +1 damage DC, increases Range by 1 grade
modReflexSightGatlingDescription: Can reroll the Hit Location die
modElectrificationModuleDescription: Damage type becomes Energy, gains Radioactive
modCompressionNozzleDescription: +1 damage DC, increases Range by 1 grade
modVaporizerNozzleDescription: +2 damage DC, increases Range by 1 grade, -1 Fire Rate
modBayonetMissileLauncherDescription: Melee Weapon, deals 4 DC Physical Piercing 1 damage
modShredderDescription: Melee Weapon, deals 6 DC Physical Piercing 2 damage
modElectrifiedBatonDescription: +1 damage DC, damage type becomes Energy, gains Radioactive
modElectrifiedSwordDescription: +1 damage DC, damage type becomes Energy, gains Radioactive
modElectrifiedSerratedSwordDescription: +2 damage DC, damage type becomes Energy, gains Radioactive, gains Persistent
modPneumaticDescription: Stun damage requires 2+ Effects to affect character
modAsbestosLiningDescription: +3 Energy Resistance, Ignores Persistent Energy damage
modStreamlinedDescription: Can spend up to 4 AP for bonus melee damage
modBalancedDescription: Melee and unarmed attacks gain Piercing 1
modStabilizedDescription: When aiming and making a Ranged Attack, damage increases by +1 DC
modMuffledDescription: Can reroll one d20 on Sneak checks
effectBurstDescription: The attack hits one additional target within Close range of the primary target for each Effect rolled. Each additional target spends 1 additional unit of ammunition from the weapon.
effectBreakingDescription: For each Effect rolled, reduce the number of DC a target's cover provides by 1, permanently. If the target is not in cover, instead reduce the DR of the location struck by 1, according to the damage type of the weaponâ€”physical damage only reduces physical DR, for example.
effectPersistentDescription: If one or more Effects are rolled, the target suffers the weapon's damage again at the end of their next and subsequent turns, for a number of rounds equal to the number of Effects rolled. The target can spend a major action to make a test to stop persistent damage early, with the difficulty equal to the number of Effects rolled, and the attribute + skill chosen by the GM. Some Persistent weapons may inflict a different type of damage to the weapon, and where this is the case, it will be noted in brackets, for example: Persistent (Poison).
effectPiercingDescription: Ignore X points of the target's DR for each Effect rolled, where X is the rating of this damage effect.
effectRadioactiveDescription: For every Effect rolled, the target also suffers 1 point of radiation damage. This radiation damage is totalled and applied separately, after a character has suffered the normal damage from the attack.
effectSpreadDescription: For each Effect rolled, your attack inflicts one additional hit on the target. Each additional hit inflicts half the rolled damage (rounded down) and hits a random location even if a specific location was targeted for the initial attack.
effectStunDescription: If one or more Effects are rolled, the target cannot take their normal actions on their next turn. A stunned character or creature can still spend AP to take additional actions as normal.
effectViciousDescription: The attack inflicts +1 damage for each Effect rolled.
effectShadowedDescription: Shadowed Armor: 1+ pieces = ignore first complication on Sneak in darkness; 3+ pieces (Torso=2) = reroll 1d20 on Sneak in darkness 1/scene; 5+ pieces (Torso=2) = reroll 1d20 on every Sneak check in darkness. Does not work with Power Armor.
effectStealthRerollDescription: Can reroll one d20 on Sneak checks
effectAimDamageBonusDescription: When aiming and making a Ranged Attack, damage increases by +1 DC
effectMeleeBonusAPDescription: Can spend up to 4 AP for bonus melee damage
effectStunResistanceDescription: Stun damage requires 2+ Effects to affect character
effectSpecialRerollDescription: Reroll one d20 per scene on a skill check based on the specified SPECIAL attribute
effectCarryWeightDescription: Increases the maximum carry weight by the specified amount
effectIgnoreLightPenaltyDescription: Ignore any difficulty increase due to excessive light
effectGasMaskDescription: +3 to Poison Damage Resistance against any airborne or gaseous poison; Wearer suffers no effects from gas or dust; +1 to difficulty of all Speech checks
qualityAccurateDescription: If you take the Aim minor action before attacking with an Accurate weapon, you may spend up to 3 AP to add +1 DC per AP spent to the attack's damage. If you gain damage in this way, you may not spend ammunition for extra damage. A weapon cannot be both Accurate and Inaccurate.
qualityBlastDescription: When you make an attack with a Blast weapon, you do not target a single opponent. Instead, select a single zone you can see, and make the appropriate skill test to attack, with a basic difficulty of 2 (adjusted for range as normal). If you succeed, every creature (and other damageable target) in that zone suffers the weapon's damage. If you fail, your misplaced attack is less effective: roll only half the weapon's DC to determine the damage inflicted to creatures in the target zone and ignore the weapon's normal damage effects.
qualityCloseQuartersDescription: A Close Quarters weapon is easy to use up-close, and suffers no difficulty increase for being used when within Reach of an enemy.
qualityConcealedDescription: A Concealed weapon is small, or otherwise easy to hide on your person. Enemies do not spot a Concealed weapon unless you're wielding it, or if they make a thorough search and succeed at a PER + Survival test with a difficulty of 2.
qualityCripplingDescription: The difficulty of any test to heal injuries caused by a Crippling weapon is increased by 1.
qualityDebilitatingDescription: The difficulty of any skill test to treat injuries inflicted by a Debilitating weapon increase by +1.
qualityGatlingDescription: Ammunition is spent at ten times the normal rate by Gatling weapons: whenever you would spend one shot of ammunition, a Gatling weapon instead spends a burst of 10 shots. Whenever you spend ammunition to increase this weapon's damage, add +2 DC per ten-shot burst (to a maximum number of bursts equal to the weapon's Fire Rate), rather than +1 DC per shot.
qualityInaccurateDescription: When making an attack with an Inaccurate weapon, you gain no benefit from the Aim minor action. A weapon may not be both Accurate and Inaccurate.
qualityMeleeDescription: Can be used as a melee weapon, inflicting 4 DC Physical Piercing damage
qualityMineDescription: When a Mine is placed onto a surface and primed, it becomes a dangerous object, inflicting its damage upon anyone who comes within Reach of it (and upon additional characters, if it has the Blast quality).
qualityNightVisionDescription: The sights of a weapon with Night Vision have been made to allow you to see more clearly in the dark. When you Aim with a Night Vision weapon, you ignore any increase in the difficulty of an attack due to darkness.
qualityParryDescription: When an enemy attempts a melee attack against you, and you are wielding a Parry weapon, you may spend 1 AP to add +1 to your Defense against that attack.
qualityReconDescription: When you Aim with a Recon weapon, you may mark the target you aimed at. The next ally to attack that target may re-roll one d20 on their attack.
qualityReliableDescription: During each combat encounter, a Reliable weapon ignores the first complication you roll on a test to use that weapon. A weapon may not be both Reliable and Unreliable.
qualitySuppressedDescription: If an enemy is not aware of you when you attack with a Suppressed weapon, they do not notice the attack unless they are the target or they pass a PER + Survival test with a difficulty of 2.
qualityThrownCDescription: A Thrown (C) weapon can be thrown, as a ranged attack with an ideal range of Close. You make an AGI + Throwing test to attack with the weapon.
qualityThrownMDescription: A Thrown (M) weapon can be thrown, as a ranged attack with an ideal range of Medium. You make an AGI + Throwing test to attack with the weapon.
qualityTwoHandedDescription: A Two-Handed weapon must be held in two hands to be used effectively; attempting to attack with a Two-Handed weapon in one hand increases the difficulty by +2.
qualityUnreliableDescription: When you make an attack with an Unreliable weapon, increase the complication range of the attack by 1. A weapon may not be both Reliable and Unreliable.
qualityMrHandyOnlyDescription: This weapon is integrated into a Mr Handy robot's body and can only be used by Mr Handy units. It cannot be equipped by other character types.
deleteCharacterAlert: Are you really sure you want to DELETE YOUR CHARACTER and EVERY OTHER SAVED DATA?
head: Head
invalidJsonFileError: Error: The selected file is not a valid JSON file.
name: Name
notEnoughAmmoAlert: You don't have enough AMMO to do it!
notEnoughLuckAlert: You don't have enough LUCK to do it!
replenishLuckAlert: Do you really want to replenish luck?
confirmDeleteCharacter: Are you really sure you want to DELETE YOUR CHARACTER and EVERY OTHER SAVED DATA?
weaponHandmadeBoltActionDescription: A makeshift weapon, easily spotted in the hands of those who can't build, buy, or scavenge anything better. Pipe weapons are crude and somewhat unreliable, but effective enough; bolt-action pipe rifles are normally made to fire rifle rounds, sacrificing fire rate for power and simplicity.
weaponDoubleBarrelShotgunDescription: Before the Great War, double-barrel shotguns were used primarily for hunting and home defenseâ€¦ and things haven't changed much. Break-action weapons, they can be found in both side-by-side and over-under configurations. Simple to build and maintain, they're not an uncommon sight in the Commonwealth and the wider wasteland.
weaponCombatShotgunDescription: Combat shotguns are pump-action shotguns normally used by a military faction for an offensive purpose: they're perfect for close-quarters fighting in tunnels, inside buildings, or amongst the ruined streets of old cities.
weaponAssaultRifleDescription: This gas-operated rifle is a common sight across the wasteland, and well-liked because of the low recoil and reasonable accuracy, and the ease of modifications. Most versions found are only capable of semi-automatic fire, but the weapon is easily modified for automatic fire.
weaponHuntingRifleDescription: A bolt-action rifle commonly found in the hands of super mutants and raiders. The simple design made them common amongst hunters and survivalists before the Great War, and they're endlessly customizable. It seems fanciful to suggest that the simple short-barreled slug-thrower carried by a super mutant could be turned into a precision sniper's rifle, yet that describes the hunting rifle perfectly.
weaponCombatRifleDescription: A pre-War weapon found across the wastelands and used in large numbers by various aggressive factions. Combat Rifles are a rugged and adaptable design, able to be modified to fill a variety of different battlefield roles.
weaponGaussRifleDescription: The gauss rifle uses magnetic induction to propel a projectile at incredible, devastating speeds. Each shot can be 'charged' for maximum damage by holding the trigger for a moment before releasing to fire.
weaponNailGunDescription: A makeshift weapon created by enterprising wasteland engineers, the nail gun uses high-pressure steam to fire railroad spikes at a velocity sufficient to pierce and impale most targets.
weaponMachineGunDescription: Submachine guns were an old design, even before the War, and while they're hideously inaccurate, their rate-of-fire means you don't need to be accurate.
weaponFortyFourPistolDescription: The .44 pistol is a double-action revolver, chambered to use the .44 Magnum cartridge. It's a powerful gun, though not as customizable as other handguns. Due to their simple, rugged design, they're prized by their owners, but not so uncommon as to be truly rare.
weaponTenMillimeterPistolDescription: Small, dependable, reasonably powerful, and widely available, the 10mm pistol has been a staple of wasteland combat since the bombs first fell. Its versatility and potential for customization mean that a well-looked-after 10mm pistol will keep its owner safe for a long time.
weaponHandmadePistolDescription: Primitive, homemade, normally wielded by those who can't build, buy, or scavenge anything better, pipe pistols are crude and somewhat unreliable, but effective enough. The most common resemble small semi-automatic pistols, made to take common .38 roundsâ€¦ though there are known to be those bold (or desperate) enough to modify them for automatic or precision fire.
weaponFlareGunDescription: A Flare gun is a break-action single-shot device not really designed to inflict damage. Rather, it shoots signal flares which are used by many factions to signal for assistance by firing them high into the air.
weaponHandmadeRevolverDescription: Like other pipe weapons, these are makeshift or homemade pistols, in this case based on a revolver. They're a middle ground between the firepower of a bolt-action and the rate-of-fire of a pistol, and being a pipe weapon, they're similarly easy to modify.
weaponSyringerDescription: A makeshift compressed-air weapon which fires customized syringes at a target. The syringes themselves do little damage, but can inflict a wide range of debilitating effects.
weaponMrHandyAutomaticPistolDescription: Automatic 10mm pistol integrated into a Mr. Handy's body. Only Mr. Handy can use this weapon.
weaponLaserPistolDescription: Laser guns are high-tech weapons which emit a concentrated beam of coherent, directional light, intense enough to inflict serious damage. They were a relatively new development in the years before the Great War, and thus are not an especially common sight in the wasteland, outside of those groups who've secured old military weapons caches. Most surviving models of laser gunâ€”such as the dependable AER9, widely used by the U. S. Armyâ€”use an internal capacitor charged by a microfusion power cell.
weaponInstituteLaserDescription: Developed by The Institute after the Great War, Institute lasers differ in design and function from the pre-War lasers used by other factions such as the Brotherhood of Steel. Eschewing raw power for a rapid succession of beams, these lasers can lay down a searing volley of suppressive fire.
weaponLaserMusketDescription: The laser musket is a homemade form of laser rifle, blending advanced technology with strangely primitive mechanisms, popular with militia groups such as the Minutemen. The laser musket must be manually primed, charging the makeshift capacitor through turning a hand-crank on the weapon's rear. While seemingly crude, they can make for potent sniper's weapons, especially with a modified capacitor able to hold a larger charge.
weaponPlasmaPistolDescription: Plasma guns, or plasma casters, are high-tech weapons firing superheated ionized gas, or plasma. These weapons are rare and potent, delivering damage through the high-speed impact of the plasma bolt and then thermal transfer as the heat from the plasma bolt is transferred into the target at the moment of impact.
weaponGammaPistolDescription: A crude-looking weapon, the gamma gun emits directed blasts of high-intensity ionizing radiation which can be devastating to any creature not immune nor massively resistant to radiation, while leaving other targets largely unharmed.
weaponMrHandyLaserEmitterDescription: Laser emitter integrated into a Mr. Handy's body. Identical to a standard laser pistol but permanently mounted on the robot. Only Mr. Handy can use this weapon.
weaponFatManDescription: The M42 Nuclear Catapult is a shoulder-fired infantry support weapon which launches compact tactical nuclear warheadsâ€”mini-nukes, each about the size of a footballâ€”over a moderate distance to inflict massive destruction upon the target location.
weaponIncineratorDescription: A heavy incinerator sprays an ignited fuel mixture over the target to burn them, launching a series of fireballs that explode on impact and ignite as the fuel splashes the target.
weaponJunkJetDescription: The Junk Jet is a makeshift heavy weapon which fires anything. Any items loaded into the weapon's hopper are hurled with deadly force from the business end of the gun. Naturally, this makes it quite useful in situations where random junk is abundant but actual ammunition is scarce.
weaponFlamethrowerDescription: A flamethrower, or flamer, is a weapon which sprays an ignited fuel mixture over an area, essentially creating a jet of flame that can burn or ignite targets at a distance. Ideal for clearing dead foliage, irritating vermin, and fortified bunkers!
weaponMissileLauncherDescription: A refined, highly adaptable multipurpose missile launcher. This modular launcher is smaller and more maneuverable than earlier models, consisting of a two-part launch tube, firing mechanism, mounting brackets, and sighting apparatus.
weaponGatlingLaserDescription: A high rate-of-fire laser weapon, the Gatling laser uses several rotating barrels fired in quick succession to produce a devastating fusillade of laser pulses. While the individual laser pulses lack in stopping power, the sheer mass of them can wear down almost any target.
weaponMinigunDescription: The minigun is a motorized Gatling-style rapid fire weapon. Miniguns can be found as mounted door guns on Vertibirds or as a handheld heavy assault and support weapon. The high rate-of-fire of the weapon means that it can produce devastating results, but at a cost of consuming ammunition at a prodigious rate.
weaponMrHandyFlamethrowerDescription: Flamethrower integrated into a Mr. Handy's body. Sprays an ignited fuel mixture over an area, essentially creating a jet of flame that can burn or ignite targets at a distance. Only Mr. Handy can use this weapon.
weaponBoardDescription: Little more than a long plank of wood with a handle wrapped in duct tape. Boards are heavy melee weapons, normally favored by super mutants who have the strength to wield them effectively.
weaponWalkingStickDescription: A simple stick used to support those who can't walk so well, a walking cane is sturdy enough to be an impromptu weapon if you've not got any other options.
weaponWeaponStockOneHandedDescription: A strike with the stock of a one-handed weapon.
weaponWeaponStockDescription: A strike with the stock of a two-handed weapon.
weaponPipeWrenchDescription: A heavy, metal, adjustable wrench, long enough to be used as a makeshift melee weapon. The adjustable jaws are often used to hold attachments, allowing the wrench to be modded extremely easily.
weaponSwitchbladeDescription: The switchblade is a commonly found melee weapon. Its small size means that it is easily smuggled into restricted areas and is easy to handle. It doesn't do as damage as larger knives or blades, however.
weaponCombatKnifeDescription: Soldiers (and those who want to emulate them) often carry a knife that serves both for combat and everyday use. Most Combat Knives found in the wasteland are the same type issued to U.S. Army soldiers during the Great War, with a single-edged clip-point blade. It's a very light and durable weapon, made to be used often.
weaponDeathclawGauntletDescription: Made from the severed fingers and talons of a deathclaw and mounted on a cuff which fits over the wrist, these allow the wearer to strike with some of the lethal force of the claws' previous owner.
weaponBoxingGloveDescription: A large, leather mitt, used to protect the hands and wrists while punching. While originally used during sporting matches, a skilled fighter can use these to deliver solid blows to enemies in less organized fights, particularly if they've modified the glove in some way.
weaponTireIronDescription: A simple L-shaped tool found commonly in cars and garages; tire irons make for handy weapons when not being used to change the tires on a car.
weaponMacheteDescription: A long, sharp knife designed for cutting through dense vegetation, which makes it both a very useful item and an effective weapon. Some of those found in the wasteland are true machetes, while others are makeshift weapons, typically consisting of a sharpened metal blade (taken from a lawnmower, for example) that is nailed, tied, glued, or otherwise attached to a simple handle.
weaponBatonDescription: A collapsible baton of the sort used by police departments and private security forces before the Great War. Vault-Tec security within each vault had a stock of these, so they remain in common use as a lightweight back-up melee weapon.
weaponSledgehammerDescription: Sledgehammers are primitive weapons, used as tools before the Great War, for breaking ground or demolishing things. Although not usually considered as a powerful weapon, a strong personâ€”or a super mutantâ€”can wield one of these like a club, taking full advantage of the hammer's weight.
weaponHammerDescription: A sturdy cylinder of wood found in kitchens everywhere. Heavy enough to deter an assortment of attackers if you haven't got something more dangerous.
weaponBaseballBatDescription: Baseball bats were once used in the sport of baseball, considered America's number-one pastime during the pre-War era. Two hundred years later, they have been re-purposed as crude but effective melee weapons. While most are made a single piece of woodâ€”normally ash, but other hardwoods are often usedâ€”a few can be found made of aluminum instead, making for a lighter, harder bat.
weaponAluminumBaseballBatDescription: Baseball bats were once used in the sport of baseball, considered America's number-one pastime during the pre-War era. Two hundred years later, they have been re-purposed as crude but effective melee weapons. While most are made a single piece of woodâ€”normally ash, but other hardwoods are often usedâ€”a few can be found made of aluminum instead, making for a lighter, harder bat.
weaponStoneDescription: A strike with a rock, a brick, etc.
weaponPowerFistDescription: A Power Fist is a reinforced gauntlet or vambrace which mounts a heavy-duty pneumatic ram over the knuckles. Designed for use by demolition crews, it has also seen military use for breaching fortifications and clearing enemy barricadesâ€¦ and enemies.
weaponRipperDescription: The Ripper is a small, handheld, militarized chainsaw that saw extensive use in the armed conflicts before the Great War, with a commercial-grade, scaled-down version made available for the general market. It can cut through flesh and metal with ease.
weaponShishkebabDescription: A makeshift 'flaming sword', the Shishkebab is found in various forms across the wastelands, with some built from an actual sword, while others are assembled from various components. All have some elements in common: some sort of tank or canister, a pilot light, and an ignition mechanism usually stolen from a motorcycle. When used, the fuel is released along the blade and ignited by the pilot light, wreathing the blade in flames.
weaponSwordDescription: Swords have been in use for almost as long as wars have been fought and remained widespread as symbols of status and prestige amongst soldiersâ€”particularly officersâ€”across the world right up until the Great War. Many of the swords found in the wasteland belonged to Chinese officers during the Great War, often taken from battlefields as a trophy by American troops. Others are museum pieces or replicas from private collections, with many resembling the cavalry sabers used during the American Revolution.
weaponPoolCueDescription: A long, slender piece of wood used in games like pool. Useful as a melee weapon if there's nothing to hand with more heft.
weaponSuperSledgeDescription: Super Sledgehammers are powered variants of the regular sledgehammer. Older, pre-War designs were outfitted with kinetic storage devices to increase the impact force, while post-War ones mount a small rocket motor within the hammer's head to accelerate the swing and deliver a heavier blow.
weaponKnucklesDescription: Developed in antiquity, this weapon is nevertheless quite prevalent in the post-Great War wastelands. Brass Knuckles, or Knuckledusters, take the form of four linked metal rings in a shallow convex formation with a bumper attached to the concave face. The rings are slipped over a combatant's fingers with the bumper pressed into the palm of the hand. When a punch is thrown, the Brass Knuckles take most of the impact impulse, transferring much of the punch's kinetic energy to the target by way of the harder, smaller impacting surface of the metal knuckles. This drastically increases the likelihood of serious tissue disruption and bone damage.
weaponLeadPipeDescription: A length of heavy, metal (normally lead) pipe, with a duct-tape wrapped grip at one end and a few nuts and bolts attached at the other. Crude, simple, and hurts like hell.
weaponMrHandyCircularSawDescription: Circular saw integrated into a Mr. Handy's body. High-speed rotating blade that can cut through hard materials. Only Mr. Handy can use this weapon.
weaponMrHandyPliersDescription: Pliers integrated into a Mr. Handy's body. Mechanical pincer used for gripping and striking. Only Mr. Handy can use this weapon.
armorRaiderChestDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorRaiderLegDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorRaiderArmDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.

It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorRaiderSturdyLegDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.

It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorRaiderHeavyChestDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorRaiderHeavyLegDescription: Makeshift armor employed by raiders and other cutthroat types across the wastes. It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.

It varies considerably in quality and appearance but tends to be made of scrap metal rudely battered into shape, reinforced by metal bars, wire, and leather straps. This barbaric appearance is often bolstered by grisly trophies such as skulls or other body parts.
armorLeatherChestDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherLegDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherArmDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherSturdyChestDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherSturdyLegDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherSturdyArmDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherHeavyChestDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherHeavyLegDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorLeatherHeavyArmDescription: Made from tanned and treated animal hide, these hardened leather pieces provide modest protection from physical impacts and gunshots, as well as serving to insulate the wearer from fire and other dangerous energies.
armorMetalHelmetDescription: Shaped metal plating held togetherâ€”and held onâ€”with leather or cloth straps, which provide decent protection from physical impacts such as melee attacks and gunshots, but less protection against energy attacks, as the metal plating conducts heat.
armorMetalChestDescription: Shaped metal plating held togetherâ€”and held onâ€”with leather or cloth straps, which provide decent protection from physical impacts such as melee attacks and gunshots, but less protection against energy attacks, as the metal plating conducts heat.
armorMetalLegDescription: Shaped metal plating held togetherâ€”and held onâ€”with leather or cloth straps, which provide decent protection from physical impacts such as melee attacks and gunshots, but less protection against energy attacks, as the metal plating conducts heat.

armorCombatHelmetDescription: Specially made armor pieces, designed pre-War and issued to the soldiers of the U.S. Armed Forces. It was constructed to keep the wearer protected from physical and energy attacks alike without being cumbersome or awkward to wear.
armorCombatChestDescription: Specially made armor pieces, designed pre-War and issued to the soldiers of the U.S. Armed Forces. It was constructed to keep the wearer protected from physical and energy attacks alike without being cumbersome or awkward to wear.
armorCombatLegDescription: Specially made armor pieces, designed pre-War and issued to the soldiers of the U.S. Armed Forces. It was constructed to keep the wearer protected from physical and energy attacks alike without being cumbersome or awkward to wear.

armorCombatHeavyArmDescription: Specially made armor pieces, designed pre-War and issued to the soldiers of the U.S. Armed Forces. It was constructed to keep the wearer protected from physical and energy attacks alike without being cumbersome or awkward to wear.
armorSyntheticHelmetDescription: Developed by The Institute, Synth armor is distinctive and provides excellent protection, especially from energy weapons, but can only really be found within the Commonwealth and other locations where Institute synths travel. The rarity of its manufacture means that it's hard to acquire for anyone not on good terms with the Institute, and expensive even then.
armorSyntheticChestDescription: Developed by The Institute, Synth armor is distinctive and provides excellent protection, especially from energy weapons, but can only really be found within the Commonwealth and other locations where Institute synths travel. The rarity of its manufacture means that it's hard to acquire for anyone not on good terms with the Institute, and expensive even then.

The rarity of its manufacture means that it's hard to acquire for anyone not on good terms with the Institute, and expensive even then.

The rarity of its manufacture means that it's hard to acquire for anyone not on good terms with the Institute, and expensive even then.
armorVaultTecSecurityHelmetDescription: Consisting of a long bulletproof apron and shoulder pads, plus an accompanying shock-resistant helmet, this armor was issued in small quantities to every vault for those vault-dwellers chosen to act as security personnel. It provides modest protection and isn't especially bulky, but it is unlikely to stand up to heavy combat, simply because vaults were expected to be controlled environments, lacking in the heavy armaments found outside.
armorVaultTecSecurityArmorDescription: Consisting of a long bulletproof apron and shoulder pads, plus an accompanying shock-resistant helmet, this armor was issued in small quantities to every vault for those vault-dwellers chosen to act as security personnel. It provides modest protection and isn't especially bulky, but it is unlikely to stand up to heavy combat, simply because vaults were expected to be controlled environments, lacking in the heavy armaments found outside.
armorBrotherhoodSteelUniformDescription: Originally designed as the underarmor bodysuit for the T-45 Power Armor system. The bodysuit's surface is covered with an assortment of interface ports and connections to connect the wearer with the Power Armor frame, over it. The Brotherhood of Steel employ these as the base of their standard uniforms, ensuring that as many of their personnel as possible are ready to wear full armor. In battle, the uniform is normally worn under other armor if Power Armor is unavailable, while senior Brotherhood officers often wear a bomber jacket or armored battlecoat over their undersuit.
armorCasualClothingDescription: Simple, lightweight, and easy to move around in, pre-War casual clothing was intended for leisure and light activity.
armorHarnessDescription: A worker's safety harness repurposed to serve as a mount for pieces of armor. Common amongst raiders, who tend to wear the harness without a shirt underneath.
armorMilitaryFatiguesDescription: A simple, hard-wearing shirt, jacket, pants, and set of combat boots designed to be worn by military personnel before the Great War. These garments are designed to be worn in unpleasant conditions, and have numerous pockets for carrying useful items, so an intact set is a decent find.
armorRoadLeathersDescription: A leather jacket, leather pants, and a set of motorcycle boots. Often decorated with metallic studs, these soft leather items provide modest protection against physical hazards such as an involuntary dismount from a motorbike, while still being reasonably comfortable in any temperate or cold climate.
armorToughClothingDescription: Hard-wearing clothing cobbled together from sufficiently sturdy garments to create an outfit that can withstand a hard life in the wasteland. Normally made from a jacket, a shirt and undershirt, a pair of jeans, and some walking boots, reinforced (or patched) with duct tape, to provide both a little protection against the bumps and scrapes of life and a bit of warmth on those cold nuclear winter nights.
armorVaultJumpsuitDescription: The standard garment for all vault inhabitants, provided by Vault-Tec. A close-fitting blue jumpsuit with a golden-yellow strip running around the neck, down the torso, and along the sleeves. This strip is a metallic foil which aids in heat dissipation and works with the suit's integrated biometric scanners. Each Vault Jumpsuit has a number on the back, signifying which vault it originated from.
armorBrotherhoodSteelFatiguesDescription: A set of basic, hard-wearing gear for Brotherhood of Steel personnel, consisting of a military sweater, pants, gloves, combat boots, and military webbing, and emblazoned with Brotherhood insignia denoting rank and role. The color of the uniform also denotes certain specializations: medics wear a version with a white sweater, while flight personnel wear navy blue. Though not intended for use in combat, these fatigues are hardwearing and resilient enough to provide a little protection against hazards.
armorBrotherhoodScribeDescription: The Scribes of the Brotherhood of Steel are sometimes required to venture out into the field to make observations or perform research up-close. While only providing limited protection, this garb is sufficient to protect the wearer from danger long enough to allow them to withdraw and seek assistance from someone better equipped.
armorCageDescription: Heavy leather clothing, reinforced with rags, metal plates, chains, and bars. Like spike armor, the metalwork creates a rough cage of rebar around the head and torso, providing extra protection. Normally worn with a hood and helmet.
armorDrifterDescription: A leather trenchcoat, sturdy hide gloves and boots, a pair of jeans, and a shirt make for an outfit that's hard wearing but comfortable for long periods of time, and warm enough on the open road to suit those who wander the wastelands.
armorEngineerDescription: Worn by Brotherhood engineers and those who style themselves as similar, this outfit consists of a protective jacket, heavy canvas or leather gauntlets, and a vest and toolbelt covered in pouches. It provides protection against the hazards of using power tools in a workshop but isn't really armor fit for the battlefield.
armorFormalClothingDescription: A nice suit, a pretty dress, or some other kind of fancy, tailored clothing. Designed to be more flattering than functional, formal clothing is helpful when you need to impress someone, and is often prized as a sign of status, presenting the appearance of someone who doesn't need to worry about their own safety.
armorHazmatSuitDescription: A completely enclosed suit for handling hazardous materials. The materials a hazmat suit is made from don't stand up well to violence; but wearing one of these renders you basically immune to radiation.
armorHeavyCoatDescription: A long, heavy-weight coatâ€”a leather duster, a trenchcoat, or similarâ€”ideal for protecting you from the harsh elements. Provides a bit of protection against physical harm, extreme heat, and even covers well enough to keep a little radiation out.
armorHidesDescription: Typically made from the rough hides of a brahmin, radstag, or other large animal, these simple clothes provide a little protection and comfort, but they're no substitute for properly made clothing or armor.
armorLabCoatDescription: A white coatâ€”though likely stained or dirtyâ€”intended for use in a laboratory environment. Normally contains a useful number of pockets, and clock or sensor just below the left lapel, where it can be easily checked without having to reach for itâ€”ideal during delicate scientific work.
armorSpikeDescription: Layers of leather, with rags, metal plates, lengths of chain, and bars sown into the layers or welded together. Many of the bars protrude outwards, creating a spiky appearance that helps fend off melee attacks, while the layers of metal plates and leather padding protect from hazards and attacks. A hood and helmet add to the protection provided.
armorUtilityCoverallsDescription: A versatile outfit favored by mechanics and other tinkerers; the coveralls are designed to protect both from hard, dirty work with machinery. Comes with heavy gloves to protect the hands, and a utility belt to hold a range of tools and other useful items.
armorArmyHelmetDescription: A helmet made of metal, plastic, and light ceramics, designed to protect a soldier's head from shrapnel. The helmet is lined with supportive padding to ensure a secure fit.
armorBrotherhoodSteelHoodDescription: The matching headpiece for the Brotherhood of Steel uniform, this close-fitting hood was developed before the Great War for wearers of Power Armor. It is designed to plug into the helmet of a suit of Power Armor, providing a closer interface to the armor's systems, as well as containing an earpiece and microphone for the armor's internal radio.
armorBrotherhoodScribeHatDescription: This lightweight leather cap and goggles are provided as an accompaniment to the Brotherhood Scribe's Armor, to protect the head from hazardous conditions.
armorCasualHatDescription: A simple, lightweight hat, normally with a peak or brim to keep the sunlight out of the wearer's eyes.
armorFormalHatDescription: A smart-looking hat, that'll look the part adorning your head during a business engagement or formal event. Or just because you like how it looks and it keeps the sun off your face. Many examples are somewhat battered and worn from neglect and ill-use, but they're still functional.
armorGasMaskDescription: A rubber and leather mask with a plastic visor, which fits with an air-tight seal over the face. The front of the mask contains a filter which cleanses the air of contaminants like dust and gas.
armorHardHatDescription: A light metal or plastic hat intended to protect the head from bumps and collisions in a busy industrial workplace or construction site. Not really intended to protect from combat, but if you're lacking a helmet, a hard had is better than nothing.
armorHoodOrCowlDescription: A cloth or leather covering for the head and neck. Provides a little protection from the elements, and easily combined with a mask or kerchief to cover the mouth and nose to keep dust and fumes out. Handy in the wasteland if you're caught outside without better protection.
armorSackHoodDescription: A tough fabric hood made from a burlap or canvas sack. Provides a little protection from dust and fumes and radiation by covering the whole head. Conveniently, it has eyeholes cut out, and some versions add in some form of makeshift breathing apparatus, though the effectiveness of these is dubious at best.
armorWeldersVisorDescription: A reinforced cap with a metal faceplate. The faceplate contains a piece of hardened tinted glass, to protect the eyes when operating welding equipment, and it can be raised and lowered as needed. Brotherhood Scribes and engineers are often seen wearing these, simply because they spend a lot of time working with metal.
modRobotPlatingStandardDescription: Standard factory plating that all new Mister Handy models come with.
modRobotPlatingMisterGutsyDescription: Mister Gutsy base plating with better thermal absorption capabilities, more resistant against Energy weapons.
modRobotFactoryArmorOpticsDescription: Mass-produced armor that provides additional storage compartments for optics.
modRobotFactoryArmorBodyDescription: Mass-produced armor that provides additional storage compartments for the main body.
modRobotFactoryArmorArmsDescription: Mass-produced armor that provides additional storage compartments for arms.
modRobotFactoryArmorThrustersDescription: Mass-produced armor that provides additional storage compartments for thrusters.
modRobotFactoryStorageBodyDescription: Factory armor with additional storage compartments to increase carrying capacity.
modRobotBasePlatingOpticsDescription: Supplemental handcrafted armor for optics that provides protection from physical hazards.
modRobotBasePlatingBodyDescription: Supplemental handcrafted armor for the body that provides protection from physical hazards.
modRobotBasePlatingArmsDescription: Supplemental handcrafted armor for arms that provides protection from physical hazards.
modRobotBasePlatingThrustersDescription: Supplemental handcrafted armor for thrusters that provides protection from physical hazards.
modRobotKnurledPlatingOpticsDescription: Coating with jagged and serrated edges for optics. Sharp points can injure attackers.
modRobotKnurledPlatingBodyDescription: Coating with jagged and serrated edges for the body. Sharp points can injure attackers.
modRobotKnurledPlatingArmsDescription: Coating with jagged and serrated edges for arms. Sharp points can injure attackers.
modRobotKnurledPlatingThrustersDescripti: Coating with jagged and serrated edges for thrusters. Sharp points can injure attackers.
modRobotPoisonousPlatingOpticsDescriptio: Handcrafted armor coated with dangerous toxic materials for optics.
modRobotPoisonousPlatingBodyDescription: Handcrafted armor coated with dangerous toxic materials for the body.
modRobotPoisonousPlatingArmsDescription: Handcrafted armor coated with dangerous toxic materials for arms.
modRobotPoisonousPlatingThrustersDescrip: Handcrafted armor coated with dangerous toxic materials for thrusters.
modRobotToxicPlatingOpticsDescription: Armor with dangerous radioactive metal coating for optics.
modRobotToxicPlatingBodyDescription: Armor with dangerous radioactive metal coating for the body.
modRobotToxicPlatingArmsDescription: Armor with dangerous radioactive metal coating for arms.
modRobotToxicPlatingThrustersDescription: Armor with dangerous radioactive metal coating for thrusters.
modRobotActivationFrameOpticsDescription: Armor equipped with actuators and motor systems for optics.
modRobotActivationFrameBodyDescription: Armor equipped with actuators and motor systems for the body.
modRobotActivationFrameArmsDescription: Armor equipped with actuators and motor systems for arms. Melee attacks deal +1 DC damage.
modRobotActivationFrameThrustersDescript: Armor equipped with actuators and motor systems for thrusters. Allows both a minor Movement action and a major Sprint action in the same turn.
modRobotVoltaicFrameOpticsDescription: Armor equipped with additional conductors and capacitors for optics.
modRobotVoltaicFrameBodyDescription: Armor equipped with additional conductors and capacitors for the body.
modRobotVoltaicFrameArmsDescription: Armor equipped with additional conductors and capacitors for arms.
modRobotVoltaicFrameThrustersDescription: Armor equipped with additional conductors and capacitors for thrusters.
modRobotHydraulicFrameOpticsDescription: Armor concealing a powerful hydraulic system for optics.
modRobotHydraulicFrameBodyDescription: Armor concealing a powerful hydraulic system for the body.
modRobotHydraulicFrameArmsDescription: Armor concealing a powerful hydraulic system for arms. Melee attacks deal +1 DC damage and gain the Stun effect.
modRobotHydraulicFrameThrustersDescripti: Armor concealing a powerful hydraulic system for thrusters.
effectKnurledDescription: When a melee attack is made against this part and the attacker suffers a complication, they also suffer 2 DC Persistent (Physical) damage. Melee attacks with knurled arms gain the Persistent (Physical) damage effect.
effectPoisonousDescription: When a melee attack is made against this part and the attacker suffers a complication, they suffer 2 DC Persistent (Poison) damage. Melee attacks with poisonous arms gain the Persistent (Poison) damage effect.
effectToxicDescription: When a melee attack is made against this part and the attacker suffers a complication, they suffer 2 DC Radiation damage. Melee attacks with toxic arms gain the Radioactive damage effect.
effectActivationArmsDescription: Melee attacks made with these arms deal +1 DC damage.
effectActivationThrustersDescription: Can perform both a minor Movement action and a major Sprint action in the same turn.
effectVoltaicDescription: All attacks that deal Energy damage deal +1 DC. The bonus increases by +1 DC for every two additional parts with Voltaic Frame (+2 DC with 3 pieces or +3 DC with 5 pieces or more).
effectHydraulicDescription: Melee attacks made with these arms deal +1 DC damage and gain the Stun damage effect.
